results.title: About Schmidt
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Michael Besman, Harry Gittes and Alexander Payne
results.brief_description: Adapted from Louis Begley’s best selling novel, “About Schmidt” examines an aging man’s ennui whilst seeking to redress the empty vacuum that has become his life. Upon retirement Schmidt discovers that his skills and knowledge are all but redundant as a new breed of company man swiftly supersedes him. At a complete loss, Schmidt decides that one positive action is to prevent the impending nuptials of his only daughter - to a waterbed salesman whom he deeply distrusts and dislikes. Part black humour, part tragi-comedy, “About Schmidt” successes are almost entirely attributable to Jack Nicholson’s winning performance as the embittered and deluded protagonist. One of the most amusing components of the film is Schmidt’s letters of emotional outpouring to a young Tanzanian orphan named Ndugu, whom he sponsors on a whim. These letters reveal Schmidt’s deep-rooted irritation and frustration at the turns his life has taken, his thwarted dreams and suppressed desires. The film is also part road movie as Schmidt embarks upon a trip en route to his daughter’s home - in a monstrous 35-foot Winnebago Adventurer. Whilst “Schmidt” succeeds on many levels, mainly as a fine portrait of a man in crisis, it is also possible to argue that the film fails to sustain its dramaturgical energy and wanes where one expects it to erupt.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New Line Cinema, Michael Besman, Harry Gittes and Alexander Payne

results.title: About Oskie
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Norman Terrick and ACMI
results.brief_description: Norman Terrick believes he would not be the man he is today without his father. He lovingly describes a hard working man, who was good at what he did and always had time for his family. Even though he passed away in 1974, Terrick has created this tribute in memory of an inspiring man.

results.title: About nothing = O nicem
results.creator_credit: Vstredni Pujcouna Film, Kratky Film, Vlastimil Brodsky, Jan Brychta, Pavel Hobl and William Bukovy
results.brief_description: An unusual animated story about a character called “Nothing”, that teases the mind in a delightful and challenging way. “Nothing” gets into the most difficult situations but - after finding a job in a circus he discovers he can successfully help the sad clown and others become happy and able to make fun again. Note: Czechoslovakian language - no subtitles.

results.title: About my dad
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Huong Duy Pham and ACMI
results.brief_description: Like his father, Huong Duy Pham was also a soldier in the South Vietnam Army. But his family connections were to prove too dangerous and Huong eventually escaped by boat and made his way to Australia where he is now living with his wife and three sons. He dedicates this story to his father.

results.title: About horses
results.creator_credit: Australian news and Information Bureau and Eric Thompson
results.brief_description: Machinery has replaced the horse in the field of light transport, and has invaded the medium and heavy traction and transport fields, but in the Australian outback there are jobs that only a horse can do. This film shows the types of horses bred in Australia from the heavy draught to the race-horse and the circus pony.

results.title: About flowers
results.creator_credit: Frank Spiller, ONF | NFB and Rene Jodoin
results.brief_description: A nature lesson taught in a field of flowers. Two children playing in a meadow learn from an elderly neighbour about the recurring growth cycle of the flowering plant. They see how and why flowers attract bees, how fertilisation occurs, how seeds form and new plants come to life in spring. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: About face
results.creator_credit: Arts Council of Great Britain and Chris James
results.brief_description: This film gallops through over 60 facial transformations, including animated caricatures of Mick Jagger, Oscar Wilde, The Queen, The Duke of Edinburgh, Prince Charles, Pablo Picasso, Idi Amin, Salvador Dali, Adolf Hitler, The Marx Brothers, and David Bowie. Music by Claude Jouvin.

results.title: About conception and contraception
results.brief_description: Animated drawings illustrate how conception occurs and the way that various birth control devices, surgical methods and ‘the pill’ function in effecting contraception. Without spoken commentary this film is designed to be used by professional personnel.
results.description: Animated drawings illustrate how conception occurs and the way that various birth control devices, surgical methods and ‘the pill’ function in effecting contraception. Without spoken commentary this film is designed to be used by professional personnel.

results.title: About a dollar's worth
results.creator_credit: Department of Defence, Defence Public Relations and Vincent Donovan
results.brief_description: Employs constructive montage and synthetic music to illustrate the benefits of the Royal Australian Air Force to Australians. Looks at training of personnel, rescue work, training of overseas personnel, and social activities.
